intro: Matelea atrocoronata, commonly known as the black-crowned matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive dark red or black corona at the base. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
